meanings.definition: The external covering or integument of an animal body, especially when soft and flexible.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's skin was soft and warm to the touch.
meanings.sent2: She felt the sun on her skin as she lay on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The skin of the banana was so thin, it tore easily.
meanings.sent4: The skin of the lake shimmered in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The snake's skin shed in one piece, like a glove coming off.

meanings.definition: The outer covering of a fruit or vegetable.
meanings.sent1: The apple's skin was shiny and red.
meanings.sent2: She peeled the skin off the potato before boiling it.
meanings.sent3: The skin of the orange was tough to chew.
meanings.sent4: The skin of the grape was so thin, you could see through it.
meanings.sent5: The peach's skin was fuzzy to the touch.

meanings.sent1: She used a knife to skin the fish before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: He carefully skinned the apple before slicing it.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she could skin a potato in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully skinned the chicken in one swift motion.
meanings.sent5: He had to skin the rabbit before preparing it for dinner.
